thread.title: Roof closed for Blue Jays-Rangers ALDS Game 1, and other tidbits
thread.title_full: Roof closed for Blue Jays-Rangers ALDS Game 1, and other tidbits | Toronto Star

author: Brendan Kennedy
title: Roof closed for Blue Jays-Rangers ALDS Game 1, and other tidbits
text:
Toronto Blue Jays vs. Texas Rangers
ALDS Game 1
Rogers Centre, Toronto
First pitch: 3:37 p.m.
Roof status: Closed.
Pitching matchup: David Price (18-5, 2.45) vs. Yovani Gallardo (13-11, 3.42)
Projected lineups:
Blue Jays:
Ben Revere – LF
Josh Donaldson – 3B
Jose Bautista – RF
Edwin Encarnacion – DH
Troy Tulowitzki – SS
Justin Smoak – 1B
Russell Martin – C
Ryan Goins – 2B
Kevin Pillar – CF
Rangers:
Delino DeShields – Cf
Shin-Soo Choo – RF
Adrian Beltre – 3B
Prince Fielder – DH
Mike Napoli – 1B
Elvis Andrus – SS
Josh Hamilton – LF
Rougned Odor – 2B
Robinson Chirinos – C
Key storylines:
PREGAME PARTY
There will be an extended pre-game ceremony starting at approximately 3:10 p.m. with the raising of the Jays’ American League East division title banner to the rafters. Both teams’ starting lineups will be introduced before the anthems and former Jays’ manager Cito Gaston will throw out the ceremonial first pitch.
PRICE’S RANGER DANGER
The Jays’ ace lefty has lost three straight playoff games to the Rangers: twice in the 2010 ALDS and again in the 2011 ALDS. Texas has also hit him harder than any other team over his career, leaving him with a 5.15 career ERA against the Rangers in 11 starts.
GALLARDO
The Rangers’ righty is carrying a 13 2/3 scoreless-innings streak against the Jays into Thursday’s game, having twice shut them out this season. But the veteran finesse pitcher had a less-than-stellar final month of the season, posting a 4.85 ERA over his final six starts while allowing opposing hitters to put up a bloated .347/.396/.556 slash line.
Players to watch:
Edwin Encarnacion
The Jays’ slugger has homered off Gallardo three times in 16 career at-bats.
Elvis Andrus
The usually light-hitting Rangers’ shortstop has owned Price in his career, hitting .429, while reaching base more than half the time in 43 career plate appearances.
